data.title: Greater White-Fronted Goose Genetic Data, Circumpolar, 1988-2009
data.text:
Attribute_Accuracy_Report:

Individual sample ID's, collection dates, sampling locations, band numbers, and reported sex of individual samples provided by collectors were cross-checked and verified to match the accompanying worksheet. Sampling locations were verified with collectors and formally labelled and cross-referenced to the Geographic Names Information Service (GNIS) or NGA GEOnet Names Server when possible. Species identification by collectors were informally verified by confirming genetic "signatures" (e.g. microsatellite size or DNA sequence) fell within expected values for the species. Field sex was not confirmed with a laboratory analysis. Genbank accession numbers were cross-referenced to the appropriate markers in attribute definitions. For quality control purposes, all genotypes were scored relative to known size standards run on each gel. These size standards were established by running them with an M13 DNA sequence ladder of known size. Additionally, ten percent of the samples were amplified and genotyped in duplicate for the 8 microsatellite loci to double-check genotype scores. Final genotype scores were reviewed by a second laboratory specialist.

Methodology:

Methodology_Type: Field

Methodology_Description:

Sex of the sampled goose was determined in the field based on morphological characteristics or cloacal examination of the bird (Ely et al. 2005).

Title:

Circumpolar variation in morphological characteristics of Greater White-fronted Geese (Anser albifrons)

Geospatial_Data_Presentation_Form: journal article

Other_Citation_Details:

Ely, C.R., A.D. Fox, R.T. Alisaukas, A. Andreev, R.G. Bromley, A.G. Degtyarev, B. Ebbinge, E.N. Gurtovaya, R. Kerbes, A.V. Kondratyev, I. Kostin, A.V. Krechmar, K. Litvin, Y. Miyabayashi, J.H. Mooij, R.M. Oates, D.L. Orthmeyer, Y. Sabano, S.G. Simpson, D.V. Solovieva, M.A. Spindler, Y.V. Syroechkovsky, J.Y. Takekawa, and A. Walsh. 2005. Circumpolar variation in morphological characteristics of Greater White-fronted Geese (Anser albifrons). Bird Study 52: 104â119.

Online_Linkage: https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00063650509461380

Methodology:

Methodology_Type: Lab

Methodology_Description:

Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification of microsatellites followed Sonsthagen et al (2004) using primer pairs as published [BCA5, BCA6, BCA9, BCA11 (Buchholz et al., 1998), CRG (Wilson et al., 2016), OXY13 (Muñoz-Fuentes et al., 2005), TSP1.20.09, and TSP1.20.46 (St. John et al., 2006)]. Genotype numbers were determined by scoring based on allele size relative to an M13 DNA sequence ladder and to samples established as size standards that were run on each gel. The code ânpâ in a cell of the data set refers to a sample that did not amplify or show any product (âno productâ).

Online_Linkage: https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1471-8286.2006.01441.x

Methodology:

Methodology_Type: Lab

Methodology_Description:

Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification of mtDNA followed Sonsthagen et al (2004) using primer pairs as published [WFGL1M (Ely et al., 2017), H542 (Sorenson and Fleischer, 1996). PCR amplifications were carried out in a 20-Î¼L volume with 2â100 ng genomic DNA, 0.5 Î¼M each primer, 1.0 Î¼M dNTPs, 10× PCR Perkin Elmer Cetus #1 buffer, and 0.2 units Taq polymerase. PCR reactions began with 94 ºC for 10 min followed by 40 cycles of 94°C for 30 sec, 50 °C for 30 sec, and 72 °C for 90 sec with a 30 min final extension at 72 °C. ExoSAP-IT® (USB Corporation, Cleveland, OH) was used to remove excess primers and dNTPs in PCR products. All samples were cycle-sequenced on a LI-COR 4200LR yielding a 366 base pair fragment for all samples.

Methodology_Citation:

Citation_Information:

Originator: Ely, C.R..

Originator: Wilson, R.E.

Process_Step:

Process_Description:

Genotype numbers for all loci were determined by scoring based on PCR product size relative to an M13 DNA sequence ladder using Gene Profiler 4.05 (Scanalytics, Inc.). Subsequent gels included these known size individuals from which relative sizes of unknown individuals were assigned using Gene Profiler 4.05 (Scanalytics, Inc.). MtDNA control region sequences from opposite strands were reconciled using LI-COR eSeq imaging software with visual proofing and aligned using AlignIR 2.0 (LI-COR, Inc., Lincoln, NE) or Sequencher 4.1.2 (Gene Codes Corporation, Ann Arbor, MI).
